Articles.Content:
To you, Whats your favorite Aircraft? Or tank? Or gun? Or your favorite? Just discuss this stuff here.

Edited October 25, 2015 by musicpenguin

The best weapon... is the maleability of the human mind.

That stuff is scary.
I'm not going to say anything because chobit will come and humiliate me when I'm wrong.
lawl rage. She does that?
"The best weapon is one you only have to fire once"
And whats that?

And whats that?

A H-bomb....
Tsar bomba.
But i have nuclear bunkers and radiation suits.... I'M ALIVE.
I reiterate: TSAR BOMBA.

i reiterate: Tsar bomba.

TSAR BOMBA FUN!!! Its so much fun to use Tsar Bombas!
Two words: Starwars program. A shield of lasers used to defend the USA from ballistic missiles.
Jebediah Kerman at the helm of a star destroyer

In all seriousness, favorite tank? The M1A2. Favorite aircraft? The short lived Comanche. Favorite firearm? This one is tough for me because all firearms have pros/cons. I like the M-16 A4 but I feel the round is too small. I like my SKS but it's not very user friendly when it comes to basic maintenance. I've never actually fired an AK so i cant really pass judgment on it. I'm going to go with the 240G. Mainly because of its sheer badassery, large round, and rate of fire.

I could go on for days about older aircraft, guns, and tanks
A Nuclear potato!

Favorite Tank: Tiger 1

Favorite Firearm: 12 Gauge Shotgun

Favorite Aircraft: Lockheed U2

Favorite Missile: Nike Zeus A

My own list of favorites:

Guns: Probably the M16, mainly because it and the M4 carbine are the only combat weapons I've ever actually fired (and the folding stock on the M4 is a bit useless when they don't let you actually adjust it, so you might as well get the solid-stock M16 anyway).

Aircraft: Overall, the A-10 Thunderbolt II / "Warthog." In part because it's ugly-cute* in airplane form, and in part because it is a giant explosive-throwing Gatling cannon given wings and a cockpit (and is also incredibly durable).

I'm also rather fond of the F-5 Tiger and its descendants, as well as older planes like the P-38 Lightning, the Supermarine Spitfire, the Il-2 Shturmovik, and the Albatros and SPAD series from World War One (in part because Red Baron was the first combat flight sim I ever played).

* Warning: TV Tropes. May ruin your life and any plans you had for the afternoon.

Edited June 3, 2013 by Specialist290
I love the a-10. forgot about it when writing the post. It's a amazing plane. Speaking of which, Has anyone successfully made a a-10 in KSP?
